alert.note: Alert for Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:44PM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Addison and Orange. In southern Vermont, Rutland and Windsor. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations continues with numerous roads remaining closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM EDT, Flooding continues in the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Rutland, Chester, Bridgewater, Barnard, Stockbridge, Woodstock Village, Killington, Pomfret, Plymouth, Reading, Royalton, Bethel, Pittsfield, Hartland, Quechee, Mendon, West Windsor, Shrewsbury and Sharon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
